title: Thieves try to pull away ATM using SUV, fail
content: Four people came in a sports utility vehicle (SUV) and tied the ATM to it with a yellow coloured belt. They tried to pull the ATM with the help of the vehicle but did not succeed, a police official said.

title: NWKRTC strike paralyses public transport in Belagavi district of Karnataka
content: A team of police officers were deputed for security duty in the bus stand. They were seen talking to commuters who were complaining that they were unable to travel due to lack of buses

title: Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh granted 40-day parole
content: The latest parole granted by the court to Ram Rahim Singh comes months after he walked out of the Sunaria jail in Haryana’s Rohtak after being granted a 21-day furlough in April.

title: Hemant Soren pens an emotional tribute to his father Shibu Soren
content: Shibu Soren’s last rites and funeral would be performed later in the day at his native village Nemra.

title: Kerala rains: Heavy rain leaves many areas in Kochi inundated
content: Heavy early-morning showers left many vulnerable stretches in Kochi city and Ernakulam district flooded even as IMD sounded a red alert for Ernakulam on Tuesday

title: Shibu Soren funeral LIVE: Former Jharkhand CM to be laid to rest at ancestral village with full state honours
content: Before his last rites, Shibu Soren's body will be kept at the Jharkhand Assembly premises for people to pay their last respects

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 12 LIVE: PM Modi felicitated at NDA meet over Operation Sindoor
content: INDIA bloc leaders will stage a protest in front of Makar Dwar in Parliament against the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar

title: Philippines President in India LIVE: Marcos Jr. to hold bilateral discussions with PM Modi
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar called on Mr. Marcos Jr and asserted that his talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi will “significantly deepen our bilateral partnership”

title: Probe under way into alleged sexual assault of child in Thane school
content: Parents alleged, a person in blue clothes sexually assaulted their daughter in the school premises on July 30 between 11.15 am and 3 pm, the officials said.

title: Gas leak blast in Hyderabad’s Medchal market kills one, injures two
content: Preliminary investigation revealed that a leak in the gas pipe had allowed gas to accumulate in the poorly ventilated space, leading to a blast when the stove was ignited.

title: Karnataka receives proposals worth ₹17,000 crore for Vijayapura District
content: Some 30 companies from the FMCG sector, 25 from the solar sector, and 15 from the textile sector have shown interest in investing in Vijayapura

title: Bus services hit as transport workers begin strike across Karnataka, passengers stranded
content: The unions went ahead with the strike despite a court stay against the agitation, underway pressing demands including wage revision

title: Consent of women employees willing to work at night compulsory in Odisha
content: No adolescent will be allowed to work in any establishment during night and employer will have to provide washroom and drinking water facilities near the workplace and ensure provisions of closed-circuit television (CCTV) surveillance, says State government

title: IAF’s unending fighter conundrum | Explained
content: Why have the MiG-21 fighter jets been called ‘flying coffins’? Why has the induction of Mk-1A jets been delayed? How many jets does the Indian Air Force intend to induct in the next two decades? Are the engines for India’s fifth generation fighter aircraft going to be indigenously developed?

title: Akali Dal protests against Punjab govt’s land pooling policy
content: ‘We will not allow one inch of land to be acquired under the AAP government’s land grabbing scheme’, says Sukhbir Singh Badal.

title: MNS chief Raj Thackeray cites bonhomie with Uddhav, urges MNS cadre to unite
content: ‘After 20 years if we brothers can come together, why can’t you put aside your differences?,’ Raj Thackeray tells partymen.

title: Uttar Pradesh floods: Varanasi Namo Ghat flooded as water level of Ganga River rises
content: Incessant rainfall in U.P. has led to floods in 13 districts of the State; all schools in Varanasi, across all boards and up to Class 12, will remain closed on August 5 and 6

title: Modi-Marcos Jr. talks will significantly deepen bilateral ties: Jaishankar
content: The visit of President Marcos Jr coincides with the 75th anniversary of India-Philippines diplomatic relations

title: Family of Jaipur man abducted in Mali seeks PM’s intervention to secure release
content: Prakash Chandra Joshi, 61, was among the three Indian nationals abducted in the Kayes region of Mali during an armed assault by suspected terrorists on July 1; the family says they have no information about his whereabouts

title: BJP raises spectre of ‘political Islam’ infiltrating Church in Kerala
content: BJP State vice-president Shone George says that radical Islamists, beholden to the SDPI and Jamaat-e-Islami, had infiltrated Church protests in sizeable numbers

title: BJP accuses Rahul Gandhi of making ‘immature’ comments against Armed Forces
content: “Such immature, anti-Army, and demoralising statements made without any evidence or facts, especially when our Army was engaged in the Galwan incident, raise serious questions,” said Gaurav Bhatia

title: Congress leaders speak in different voices on Trump’s tariff threat
content: Jairam Ramesh calls out ‘image building’ exercise as part of foreign policy; his party colleague Manish Tewari asks U.S. President Trump not to lose sleep over additional tariffs

title: As per SC order, J&K govt. takes over iconic Nedou’s Hotel in Gulmarg
content: The Nedou’s family and their staff, ran the place for the past 137 years; it was a smooth transition, says official

title: Do not politicise my meeting with Stalin, says O. Panneerselvam
content: In a statement, he terms as “indecent” the attempts by some to paint his visit to the Chief Minister’s residence in a political light

title: Will not interfere in Madras High Court order against DMK membership drive, says Supreme Court
content: The case pertains to the DMK collecting mobile numbers from the people as part of its Oraniyil Tamil Nadu drive

title: Tamil Nadu signs MoUs worth ₹32,554 crore at investors conclave
content: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin reaffirms his government’s commitment to industrial development in the southern districts. He announces 4 major projects for Thoothukudi and Tirunelveli districts

title: India’s marine fish landings drop 2% in 2024: CMFRI
content: Gujarat retained its top position in overall fish landings with 7.54 lakh tonnes, followed by Tamil Nadu (6.79 lakh tonnes)

title: Rights group blames J&K Police for backlash against Kashmiris after Pahalgam attack
content: The forum said the police provided “hasty and incorrect information” that triggered “hate speech and hateful actions against Kashmiris”

title: Amit Shah holds meet with West Bengal MPs, kick-starts poll preparations
content: Special Intensive Revision of voter list and seats reserved for Scheduled Castes and Tribes come in for special mention

title: Army Chief Hails Operation Sindoor as landmark in India’s counter-terrorism doctrine
content: At an event in IIT Madras, he says 88-hour operation was unprecedented in scale, range, depth, and strategic impact, and was executed across the DIME spectrum

title: SC questions U.P.’s use of ordinance to take control of Banke Bihari temple
content: Justice Surya Kant expressed disapproval of the clandestine manner employed to secure the court’s permission in getting a judgment on May 15 by filing a civil dispute to use temple funds to develop the Shri Banke Bihari Temple Corridor project

title: Defence panel reviews women’s role; Rajnath vows greater representation
content: Defence officials highlight expanding opportunities for women across all three armed services as Centre gives commitment to facilitate greater inclusion

title: RTC strike to go ahead from August 5 despite High Court direction: JAC
content: A final round of talks was held on Monday between Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy, and representatives of the employees’ union, but the discussions ended without a resolution.

title: BJP leader Amit Malviya’s ‘no language called Bengali’ jibe sparks outrage, leaves Trinamool fuming
content: The Trinamool Congress accused the BJP of ‘systematically promoting xenophobia and othering, with Bengalis being deliberately targeted across States’

title: Operation Sindoor and Chenab Bridge to feature on Independence Day invites
content: Independence Day invites from the Ministry of Defence for this year’s Independence Day celebrations will have Operation Sindoor as the central theme

title: Bihar leaders find SIR draft rolls ‘difficult’ to compare
content: While the Election Commission has said that no political party in the State has filed an objection, the Opposition parties allege that the poll body has “deliberately” made comparison of current and earlier rolls complicated

title: Trade unions, farm outfits demand parliamentary approval of trade treaties
content: CTUs and SKM urge the Centre to reject U.S. tariffs, uphold sovereignty of India; in joint statement, they say ‘East India Company colonised India through trade and today, CETA and U.S. trade deals are the new instruments of corporate imperialism’

title: Pollution Control Boards have power to impose restitutionary damages under Water, Air Acts, says Supreme Court
content: The aim is to completely restore polluted air and waterbodies back to their original, pristine selves in an ecosystem, says Bench

title: Modi likely to take ride on Yellow Line metro, launch Vande Bharat to Belagavi
content: The Karnataka unit of the Bharatiya Janata Party is leaving no stone unturned to turn the twin inaugurations into a high-profile occasion.

title: Kerala HC dismisses habeas corpus petition after woman appears before court
content: The petitioner claimed that he had married the woman, who was traced by the police at Maradu in Kochi, in 2022 after meeting her through a matrimonial website

title: Nitish Kumar announces domicile policy, new welfare schemes in Bihar
content: The new policy will apply from the Teachers Recruitment Examination-4 in 2025 onward; only Bihar residents will now be eligible for government teaching positions under this policy

title: Skeletal remains found at new location near site no. 11 in Dharmasthala
content: Complainant suggests that a site at a new location nearby site no. 11 also be dug; new site not among the 13 identified by him before

title: PM Modi to address NDA Parliamentary Party meeting on August 5
content: The Prime Minister is also likely to be felicitated by the parliamentary party over his government's military response to the terror strike

title: Producer Sandra Thomas to take legal recourse after rejection of nominations for KFPA office-bearer election
content: She alleges that returning officer acted at the behest of a few persons who have been controlling the apex body of producers for long

title: Bombay High Court says ‘No’ to contempt proceedings against CPI(M)
content: The party has publicly criticised the court’s recent observations while rejecting its plea to hold a protest in support of Gaza

title: Karnataka Health Department brings AYUSH medicines, testing labs under FSDA purview
content: ‘Move is to control the quality of medicines being prescribed under the alternative systems of medicine, especially as their consumption continues to rise among the public’

title: Buzz from NFL training camps: What we learned about the Packers, Ravens, Titans and 13 more teams
content: Our national reporters visited 16 NFL teams since training camps began, talking to players and coaches about what to expect this season.

title: Sources: Banged-up Browns sign 5th QB in Huntley
content: The Browns are signing quarterback Tyler Huntley, sources said, adding depth with multiple passers nursing injuries.

title: Chargers' Perryman out of jail, won't face charges
content: Chargers linebacker Denzel Perryman was released from police custody Monday afternoon and will not face criminal charges after he was arrested Friday night.

title: Sources: Raiders trade CB Bennett to Eagles
content: The Raiders are trading cornerback Jakorian Bennett to the Eagles in exchange for defensive tackle Thomas Booker IV, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Boone: Judge rejoining Yanks for Tuesday's game
content: Yankees slugger Aaron Judge will be activated from the injured list before Tuesday's game against the Rangers, manager Aaron Boone said after his team lost its fourth straight Monday.

title: New Cubs starter Soroka (shoulder) headed to IL
content: New Chicago Cubs starter Mike Soroka left his first game with his new team with right shoulder discomfort and will require a stint on the injured list.

title: Sources: LeBron congratulated Luka on new deal
content: LeBron James congratulated Luka Doncic on his new three-year, $165 million contract extension via a video call Saturday, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Guards' Enright, battling cancer, earns first save
content: Guardians reliever Nic Enright recorded his first career save on Monday night, more than three years after he was diagnosed with Hodgkin lymphoma.

title: Fan accused of sex toy toss faces multiple charges
content: The man arrested for allegedly throwing a sex toy onto the court during last week's Valkyries-Dream game faces charges of disorderly conduct, public indecency/indecent exposure and criminal trespass, according to law enforcement records.

title: 🛑Fantasy football: Do Not Draft list
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in fantasy football drafts.

title: The 11 teams that make the inaugural college football Impatience Index
content: CFP aspirations. Major investments. Too many losses. Fans are never patient, but these teams might have a right.

title: From another title in OKC to new plans in Phoenix, what is every team 'all-in' for in 2025-26?
content: Not everyone can be all-in for the title in 2025-26. See each franchise's priority No. 1 for the upcoming season.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including De'Aaron Fox, Spurs max extension
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: WNBA trade grades: Wings cut ties with Carrington, look to future
content: The Lynx added DiJonai Carrington as WNBA contenders upgrade their rosters before the Aug. 7 trade deadline.

title: The team that absolutely cooked, most frustrated fan bases and more: Passan's 2025 MLB trade deadline awards
content: Here's what we learned from this year's deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: How the NL West was won? Why A.J. Preller's Padres went all-in at trade deadline
content: Inside the bold deals that showed San Diego means business as it chases the defending champion Dodgers.

title: Inside the winning formula that has Clemson poised for a championship run
content: With Cade Klubnik heading a large group of returnees, Dabo Swinney has Tigers fans thinking national title.

title: Why Luka Doncic left guaranteed money on the table to chase an even bigger future payday
content: The Luka Era in L.A. has officially begun. Here's what you need to know about Doncic's three-year, $165 million deal.

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: From Real Madrid to Man United, have last season's issues been fixed this summer?
content: There are several big clubs that regressed in a major way last season, including Real Madrid (no defense) and Man United (scoring goals). Have these 10 clubs done enough to fix those issues in the offseason?

title: Breaking down the FC 100: Which clubs were best represented? Who made the list for the 9th straight year?
content: While this year's FC 100 saw a staggering number of new faces, three stalwarts have made every edition of the rankings. Here's what else we learned from digging into the data.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Current pick right up where they left off
content: The NWSL is back from its summer break, and the Kansas City Current haven't skipped a beat. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Pickups: Seven players seizing post-deadline opportunity
content: As the MLB season moves beyond the trade deadline, here are the players you should be claiming off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: Betting buzz: Baldwin favorite as Misiorowski injury shakes up NL Rookie race
content: Drake Baldwin emerges as heavy NL Rookie of the Year favorite after Jacob Misiorowski's odds slide after injury.

title: Solak's annual ranking of all 32 NFL coaching staffs: A new No. 1 and No. 32 ahead of the season
content: We used past performance, future expectations, in-game decision-making and more to rank coaching staffs.

title: 'I am useless': Hamilton spiraling in dire Ferrari debut year
content: In February, Lewis Hamilton was full of smiles, eager to win a championship for Ferrari. Six months later, he sounds defeated.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: Rape Convict Ram Rahim Gets Another Parole, This Time For 40 Days
content: Rape convict Gurmeet Ram Rahim has been granted a 40-day parole, three months after he was given a 21-day furlough.

title: Explained: Netanyahu's Big Gaza Plan, Why Israel Military Doesn't Like It
content: Nearly two years into war in Gaza, Israeli Prime Minister BenjaminNetanyahuis reportedly planning to fully occupy the shattered Palestinian enclave, despite objections from within the Israel Defense Forces.

title: Men Dressed As  'Babas' Rob Woman On Delhi Streets, Arrested
content: In an alarming case, the Delhi Police have arrested four individuals who allegedly posed as spiritual men or 'babas' to carry out a snatching incident in broad daylight.

title: Who Is PB Balaji, First Indian To Head Tata-Owned Jaguar Land Rover
content: Currently the Group CFO at Tata Motors, PB Balaji will step into the new role in November, following the retirement of Adrian Mardell at the end of his term.

title: Health, Quality In Focus In Andhra Pradesh's New Liquor Policy
content: The Andhra Pradesh government is set to introduce a new liquor policy from September 1, with Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu emphasising a shift in focus from revenue generation to public safety.

title: Army Man Thrashed In Nagpur After 'Fight Over Parking', Car Thrown In Drain
content: An army officer was thrashed by four people last week, allegedly after he had a minor altercation with them over parking in Maharashtra's Nagpur.

title: NASA Chief Sean Duffy Plans To Accelerate Moon Reactor Plans
content: NASA's acting administrator Sean Duffy plans to accelerate the construction of a nuclear reactor that could be used on the moon and alter the way NASA will partner with industry to replace the aging International Space Station.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 12 Live Updates: PM Modi Felicitated By NDA MPs For Op Sindoor Success
content: The Opposition is likely to continue protests in both the Houses of Parliament even as the government has decided to push its legislative agenda and aim to get five listed Bills passed in both the Houses today.

title: Vigilante Groups Intensify Illegal Immigrant Hunt In Assam's Sivasagar
content: In Assam's Sivasagar, a vigilante movement has intensified pricking the political fault lines in the state, with civil society organisations carrying out an overdrive to detect suspected illegal immigrants.

title: Tata-Owned Jaguar Land Rover Appoints First Indian CEO, PB Balaji
content: Jaguar Land Rover has named PB Balaji as its Chief Executive Officer, the first Indian to hold the top position at the marquee British brand.

title: "Your Dream, Now My Promise": Hemant Soren's Emotional Note For 'Dishom Guru'
content: Shibu Soren, a towering figure in Indian tribal politics and founder of the Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM), died on Monday at the age of 81. He died at Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in New Delhi after a prolonged illness.

title: "Shri Ram", "Mata Sita", "Kawwa": Bihar Residence Certificate Applicants
content: After a residence certificate issued in the name of "Dog Babu" -- and immediately cancelled -- multiple mischievous applications for residence certificates are coming to light.

title: Woman Kills Constable Husband In Front Of Minor Son, Then Dies By Suicide
content: A woman allegedly killed her police constable husband in the presence of their 7-year-old son in Gujarat's Ahmedabad city on Monday and then died by suicide, an official said.

title: Anil Ambani Summoned In Rs 17,000 Crore Loan Fraud Case Today
content: Reliance Group chairman Anil Ambani will today appear before probe agency Enforcement Directorate for questioning in connection with an alleged Rs 17,000 crore worth bank loan fraud-linked money laundering case.

title: 'We Are Supported By BRICS Partners': Russia On Trump's Tariff Threats
content: Russia has accused the Donald Trump administration in the US of pursuing a "neocolonial" policy against nations in Global South to maintain Washington's hegemony, and said no amount of tariffs and sanctions could change the natural course of history.

title: "Nothing Will Happen": Omar Abdullah Amid J&K Statehood Restoration Buzz
content: Omar Abdullah's remarks came on the eve of the sixth anniversary of the abrogation of Article 370, amidst a growing chorus for the restoration of statehood to Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Andhra Deploys 'Kumki' Elephants To Combat Rising Human-Elephant Conflict
content: The Government of Andhra Pradesh has deployed specially trained "Kumki" elephants to the regions most affected by the long-standing issue of human-elephant conflict.

title: 55 Years Later, An Emotional Homecoming For Maharashtra Minister At 'Meghdoot'
content: In a heartwarming moment, Maharashtra's Tourism Minister and Shiv Sena leader Shambhuraj Desai was seen in tears as he stepped into the government bungalow 'Meghdoot,' the very home where he was born and raised over five decades ago.

title: "Hell Hath No Fury Like Woman's Wrath": Rani Kapur's Lawyer To NDTV
content: Lawyer Vaibhav Gaggar also spoke about the cease-and-desist letter sent by automotive parts manufacturer Sona Comstar - part of the Rs 30,000 crore Sona Group - to Sunjay Kapur's mother Rani Kapur.

title: "Result Of NATO Policies": Russia Exits Nuclear Treaty With US After Trump's Submarine Move
content: Amid US President Donald Trump's increasing pressure to end the war in Ukraine, Russia has announced that it no longer considered itself bound by the 1987 Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty with America.

title: Tariff war: Why Trump's threat is unlikely to wean India off Russian crude - Explained
content: India is likely to continue sourcing crude oil from Russia if it remains cheaper, despite potential pressure from the US government. The decision is based on prioritizing consumer interests and market realities, with India emphasizing the transparency of its oil trade with Russia. Recent decline in India's crude petroleum imports from Russia is due to market dynamics.

title: Unpaid salaries, wage revision: Why Karnataka transport workers are protesting
content: A strike by Karnataka's state-run transport workers has disrupted bus services across the state, causing significant inconvenience to commuters. The workers are protesting over unpaid salaries, wage revision delays, and privatization concerns. Despite a high court directive to halt the strike, unions proceeded, demanding the release of 38 months of arrears.

title: Gill’s baptism by Bazball: Calm head, bat full of runs and a gun team
content: Shubman Gill's first Test captaincy assignment, during the England tour, presented a mix of challenges and triumphs. Despite losing key players like Rishabh Pant and Jasprit Bumrah to injuries and workload concerns, Gill led India to a series-levelling victory. His impressive batting performance, scoring 754 runs, coupled with his focus on team dynamics, eased the transition from the Rohit Sharma era.

title: ‘Unable to accept erosion of its dominance’: Russia slams Trump’s tariffs
content: Russia accuses the United States of pursuing a neocolonial agenda through increased tariffs on the Global South, citing Washington's inability to accept a shifting global order. Maria Zakharova asserts that these actions, particularly against nations like Brazil, undermine free trade principles and threaten global economic stability.

title: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet shares career advice she got from her father at 15: ‘You're never…’
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet attributes her success to a childhood lesson from her father: strive for excellence to be undeniable. This principle fueled her journey from a speech contest loss to leading a global consulting firm. Sweet emphasizes adaptability, echoing Jamie Dimon and Satya Nadella, as crucial for sustained growth and relevance in today's dynamic business landscape.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Cricket doesn't stop for anyone!' - Ex-India player makes cryptic post
content: India clinched a six-run victory against England in the final Test at The Oval, drawing the series 2-2. Mohammed Siraj's stellar performance led India's comeback after initial defeats. Irfan Pathan's social media post emphasized cricket's ongoing nature amidst team transitions. The young Indian squad showcased resilience, proving their readiness to carry the legacy forward.

title: Republican lawmaker says 'end Indian H‑1B visas': What it means; what’s at stake for students
content: US Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene’s call to end “Indian H-1B visas replacing American jobs” has sparked concern among international students and professionals. Shared on August 4, 2025, the post adds to ongoing immigration and trade debates. While no policy changes have occurred, the rhetoric highlights shifting views on employment-based visas and post-study work pathways in the US.

title: IND vs ENG Test | Tired, tested & triumphant: India squares series at Oval
content: In a dramatic climax at The Oval, Mohammed Siraj’s fiery 5/104 powered India to a thrilling six-run win over England, leveling the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy 2-2. Shubman Gill’s young side defied odds, holding their nerve in a tense finish. The match, and series, pushed both teams to their absolute limits.

title: Chinese engineers: The 'important angle' Microsoft missed while revealing SharePoint hack
content: Microsoft revealed Chinese state-sponsored hackers exploited SharePoint vulnerabilities, breaching numerous organizations. Crucially, China-based engineers maintained the compromised software, raising security concerns about foreign access to critical US systems. This revelation follows prior reports of Microsoft utilizing foreign workers for sensitive Defense Department cloud systems, prompting government scrutiny.

title: 'Bigger than my grown cat': Massive 22-inch rat in UK home; residents call for action
content: Residents in Normanby, UK, are alarmed by a 22-inch rat found in a home, sparking concerns about a growing infestation. The surge in sightings is attributed to overflowing bins, overgrown land, and reduced pest control services. Councillors are urging immediate action to address waste management and reinstate support for domestic pest control to protect public health.

title: How Ukrainian soldier dodged death and mines on e-bike flown in by drone - video
content: In a daring rescue, a wounded Ukrainian soldier, call sign "Tanker," was saved after being stranded in enemy territory near Siversk. Following a Russian ambush, his brigade devised a plan to deliver an e-bike by drone. Despite initial failures and a landmine incident, Tanker managed to reach his unit. Amidst this, Kyiv faced renewed missile strikes, prompting President Zelensky to urge allies for action against Russia.

title: Chak De India! Tharoor points out holes in Indian team, bats for Sarfaraz's inclusion
content: Following India's thrilling Test victory against England, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor lauded the team's performance, highlighting contributions from Gill, Siraj, Jaiswal, and others. While praising the team's strengths, Tharoor pointed out the need for a strong middle-order batsman, pace-bowling backups, and a fast-bowling all-rounder.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook confirms: Majority of new iPhones sold in the US are 'made' in India
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook stated that most iPhones sold in the US during the last quarter were made in India, despite Donald Trump's criticism of this manufacturing shift. India has become the main hub for iPhone production for the US market, while China focuses on non-US regions. Apple is experiencing record revenue growth in India, driven by strong iPhone sales.

title: India upcoming matches 2025: Full cricket schedule after England series
content: Following a drawn Test series against England, India faces a busy cricket schedule in 2025. The Asia Cup in September will see a young team led by Suryakumar Yadav, while Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli return for the ODIs in Australia. The year concludes with a full home series against South Africa, featuring Tests, ODIs, and T20Is.

title: Security lapse at Red Fort: Dummy bomb goes undetected in security drill; 7 personnel suspended
content: In a significant security lapse, seven police personnel have been suspended after failing to detect a dummy bomb during a routine drill at Delhi's Red Fort. The security test aimed to assess the alertness of officers at the access control point. A team successfully breached security with a fake explosive, raising serious concerns about preparedness.

title: Karnataka bus strike begins: Employees defy HC order as talks fail; thousands stranded
content: Karnataka's public transport system is paralyzed as state road transport corporation employees initiate an indefinite strike, demanding wage revision and clearance of salary arrears. Despite a High Court stay, bus services are suspended across major cities, leaving commuters stranded and scrambling for alternatives.

title: Latest WTC Points Table: India climb to third , England slide
content: India, who were fourth before the Oval Test, have moved up to third in the WTC standings, swapping places with England, who dropped to fourth after suffering their second defeat of the cycle. Although both teams have identical records, two wins, two losses, and one draw, England lost two crucial points due to a slow over rate in the Lord’s Test, giving India the edge.

title: Stock market today: Nifty opens below 24,650; Sensex down over 300 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Monday. While Nifty50 was below 24,700, BSE Sensex dropped over 150 points.

title: 'Decision made': Israel to take full control of the Gaza Strip?
content: Amid stalled ceasefire talks, Israel is reportedly considering a plan to fully occupy the Gaza Strip, potentially escalating its conflict with Hamas. According to Israeli media, Prime Minister Netanyahu has privately discussed this move, despite opposition from within the military establishment. This shift follows a breakdown in hostage negotiations and growing frustration over Hamas's control.

title: Brooke Hogan’s husband slams Hulk Hogan: No effort to meet grandkids — “There was no interest”
content: Hulk Hogan's relationship with his daughter Brooke was strained before his death, with her husband, Steven Oleksy, revealing Hogan showed no interest in meeting his newborn twins, despite Brooke's efforts to reconnect. The couple had moved to Florida to support Hogan, but he remained distant, leaving Brooke heartbroken by unanswered attempts to reconcile.

title: IND vs ENG | 'I only believe in S...' – Google salutes Siraj's heroics at Oval
content: Mohammed Siraj's sensational five-wicket haul propelled India to a thrilling six-run victory over England at The Oval, leveling the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy 2-2. Siraj's match-winning performance dismantled England's batting lineup on the final day, overcoming earlier setbacks like a dropped catch. Google India celebrated Siraj's heroics with a clever tribute referencing his viral quote about Jasprit Bumrah.

title: 'Toughest days of my life': Hemant Soren pens emotional note after father's death
content: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren penned a heartfelt tribute to his father, Shibu Soren, following the JMM founder's death at 81. Describing it as his life's toughest time, Soren acknowledged the immense loss for both himself and the state. He vowed to continue his father's struggle for tribal empowerment, honoring his legacy of unwavering dedication and sacrifice.

title: Salaries of Bengaluru players, including Chhetri, suspended; club issues statement
content: Bengaluru FC have suspended salaries for its first-team players and staff, including Sunil Chhetri, due to uncertainty surrounding the Indian Super League's future. This decision follows unresolved issues between FSDL and AIFF, impacting the league's continuation. The club emphasises its commitment to youth development while urging a swift resolution to the impasse for the sake of Indian football.

title: Venus Williams addresses plastic surgery stance: Emphasizes comfort with her natural look
content: Venus Williams, the tennis star, recently shared her perspective on cosmetic surgery, emphasizing personal empowerment over societal expectations. While content with her current appearance, she stated she would consider procedures if it enhanced her self-esteem. After overcoming health challenges, including fibroid surgery, she made a comeback to professional tennis with the support of her fiancé, Andrea Preti.

title: Ram Rahim free again: Dera chief given 40-day parole; to return to prison mid-September
content: Gurmeet Ram Rahim, the head of Dera Sacha Sauda, has been released on a 40-day parole. This is his second release this year. Earlier, he was granted furlough in April. Ram Rahim is serving time for rape and murder convictions since 2017. His release has sparked discussions, considering his past conviction.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Do you think the jawans complain about the cold?' - Gavaskar
content: Sunil Gavaskar slammed the growing trend of workload management, urging players to show the same commitment as soldiers guarding the borders. Praising Siraj’s relentless effort across five Tests and Pant’s bravery, Gavaskar emphasized national pride, saying representing India is a rare honour that shouldn't be compromised due to minor injuries.

title: 'Scared to resume work': Indian cab driver attacked in Dublin; hit twice on head
content: An Indian cab driver in Dublin was assaulted and injured after being struck with a bottle by passengers who also shouted xenophobic remarks. The incident, which occurred in Poppintree, Ballymun, left the driver, Lakhvir Singh, traumatized and hesitant to return to work.

title: Impending disaster: Bageshwar mines risk collapse, govt report warns of Jyotirmath-style sinking
content: A government panel warns that unregulated mining in Bageshwar is creating a Jyotirmath-like crisis. Unsafe excavation practices are causing landslides and spring depletion. Residents report cracks in houses and declining crop yields. The National Green Tribunal has directed a seismic study. The High Court has stayed mining activity and ordered inspections.

title: Watch: Gambhir and India coaches go wild after win at The Oval
content: Gautam Gambhir's passionate celebrations highlighted India's dramatic six-run victory over England at The Oval, securing a 2-2 series draw. The win, fueled by Mohammed Siraj's five-wicket haul, marked a turning point for Gambhir's coaching tenure after facing initial challenges. Under Shubman Gill's captaincy, the team displayed resilience and fighting spirit throughout the intense Test series.

title: IND vs ENG |‘It had to be Siraj’ – Ex-England skipper on India’s fightback
content: Nasser Hussain lauded India's well-deserved 2-2 series draw against England, emphasising Mohammed Siraj's pivotal role in securing the final wicket. He highlighted the captivating nature of the series, with each Test extending to the final day, and stressed the responsibility of cricket's 'Big Three' to protect Test cricket's future amid concerns about its viability in other nations.

title: IND vs ENG Test | Ben Stokes on verbal duels: 'Pretty sure no one's crying''
content: The Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy witnessed heated exchanges between India and England players. Despite the tension, Ben Stokes downplayed the incidents. India secured a thrilling six-run victory in the fifth Test. This resulted in a 2-2 draw in the series. Mohammed Siraj's outstanding bowling performance led India to victory. He took five wickets in the final innings.

title: India fans make unusual demands after Telangana Police congratulates DSP Siraj
content: Mohammed Siraj's stellar performance in the fifth Test against England led to widespread admiration. The Telangana Police congratulated the Hyderabad-born pacer. Fans humorously demanded Siraj's promotion within the police force. Siraj is currently a Deputy Superintendent of Police under the sports quota. He ended the series as the highest wicket-taker. His performance helped India level the series.

title: 114-year-old Shigeko Kagawa becomes Japan's oldest living person; shares one SIMPLE longevity tip, 'I don’t have....'
content: The love of her family members serves as the foundation for Ms. Kagawa's happiness. She receives continuous joy through the combination of home support and her friendships with both former patients, and her existing social network. Local officials have honored her outstanding life achievements through official recognition for her dedicated service to the community

title: Gabrielle Union on menopause: 'It makes it hard' — motherhood now more emotional, exhausting
content: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union discussed her experience with menopause and motherhood. She spoke about the challenges she faced, including hot flashes and memory loss. Union also mentioned the impact of an autoimmune issue. She and Dwyane Wade welcomed their daughter, Kaavia, via surrogacy in 2018. Union had previously experienced miscarriages.

title: IND vs ENG: Gavaskar flaunts his 'lucky jacket' after India level series 2-2 - Watch
content: Sunil Gavaskar's 'lucky jacket,' worn during India's Gabba Test victory in 2021, resurfaced during the thrilling India vs England series finale. Gavaskar proudly displayed the jacket after India's dramatic six-run victory at The Oval, which levelled the series 2-2. He had hinted at wearing it, believing it would bring luck, and indeed, India secured a memorable win.

title: Top stocks to sell today: Recommendations for August 5- check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan suggests selling Naukri and Tata Motors. Naukri, trading below its 200 DMA, is expected to decline to Rs 1320, while Tata Motors, having broken a consolidation pattern, is projected to fall to Rs 585.

title: Viral video: Wild! KL Rahul's father-in-law Suniel Shetty goes crazy after India win
content: India defeated England in a thrilling Test match at The Oval, with the series ending in a 2-2 draw. Mohammed Siraj took five wickets. Suniel Shetty's enthusiastic celebration went viral. Ahan Shetty and Athiya Shetty shared their excitement online. Other Bollywood stars like Kareena Kapoor Khan and Anil Kapoor also celebrated the victory. The win sparked national pride and celebration.

title: ‘Saved from gallows only due to age’: 5 cops jailed till death for fake encounter
content: In a landmark verdict, a CBI court in Mohali sentenced five former Punjab Police officials to life imprisonment for the 1993 abduction, torture, and murder of seven innocent individuals, including three SPOs. The court cited the convicts' advanced age as the only reason for not imposing the death penalty, emphasizing their inhumane conduct. Each convict was also fined Rs 3.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ Box Office: Film past Rs 302 cr mark in India; lowest single-day earning on third Monday
content: Mohit Suri's romantic drama 'Saiyaara' starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda made over Rs 300 crore. The film slowed down in its third week. 'Saiyaara' earned Rs 172.75 crore in its first week and Rs 107.75 crore in the second. New releases like 'Mahavtar Narsimha', 'Son Of Sardaar 2', and 'Dhadak 2' are now in cinemas.

title: Japan’s oldest living person Shigeko Kagawa turns 114; shares longevity tips
content: Shigeko Kagawa, a 114-year-old retired physician, has been recognized as Japan's oldest living person, following the passing of Miyoko Hiroyasu. Kagawa attributes her longevity to a life of freedom, independence, and playfulness, embodying Japan's 'ikigai' philosophy. Japan's high life expectancy is attributed to factors like diet, active lifestyles, strong social connections, and accessible healthcare.

title: Josh Allen delights at Bills camp: Reunites with Oishei Children’s Hospital; touching fan moment
content: At Buffalo Bills training camp, Josh Allen impressed with his on-field performance, connecting with receivers despite injuries. The highlight, however, was a heartwarming reunion with Annabella and Blake, two Champion kids from Oishei Children’s Hospital. Allen, who supports the hospital through the Patricia Allen Fund, shared selfies and signed autographs, creating a memorable moment beyond the game.

title: Unemployment: Less than 15% placed under PMKVY; what govt data shows
content: Government data reveals that over 1.6 crore Indian youth have been trained under PMKVY since 2015, but job placements remain low, with only 24.3 lakh securing employment. The government is now focusing on aligning skilling with industry needs through district-level studies and financial schemes to promote self-employment, while also evaluating PMKVY 4.0 for improvements.

title: Night 2 results: Lesnar returns, Rhodes wins undisputed WWE championship
content: SummerSlam Night 2 featured the latest installment of the  John Cena retirement tour , as he put his Undisputed WWE Championship up for grabs against former titleholder Cody Rhodes at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey. After a marathon "street fight" match, Rhodes won his title back from the legend Cena. After the match, Brock Lesnar made his return to the WWE, delivering an F-5 to a stunned Cena. That was the final of many title matches on Night 2. Naomi retained her title in the opening match of the card, and Becky Lynch retained hers with a win over Lyra Valkyria. Later, Solo Sikoa outlasted Jacob Fatu in a steel cage match to retain the United States Championship, and Dominik Mysterio held on to the men's Intercontinental Championship with a win over AJ Styles. ESPN reporter Greg Wyshynski highlights the biggest moments and more from SummerSlam Night 2.
